title: Sheet Music
content: Sheet music is how music is written down. It’s reasonably simple to read, but everything you can do in music can be expressed in sheet music. In this topic we’re just browsing over each area, we’ll cover everything in more detail in later topics. Let’s have a look at what sheet music can do!

title: Note Lengths
content: The note length, intuitively, represents how long a note is played for. The length of a note is communicated either by how filled in the bulb is, or the shape of the tail.

title: Note Pitch
content: The pitch of the note means how high or low it sounds. To indicate this we use staves - the 5 lines you see running across the page. Each staff has its own pitch, which it gives to any notes on it. Each gap between the staves also has its own pitch!

title: Time Signature
content: A time signature tells the musician how many beats are in a bar. This is quite a complex topic, so we won’t get much into it here!

title: Key Signatures
content: The key signature lets us know what key we’re playing in. We’ll go over keys in a later topic!

title: Sheet Music
content: So there’s a few of the main features of sheet music. We didn’t go into them in much detail, so have a look at the next topics where we explain them a bit more!
